div.p:
At last, dear Mr Smyth, I redeem my promise of bestowing your name on some noble tree of Australia as a permanent record also in phytographical science of your valued labours in this country.
Villaresia smythii (B66.10.01, p. 156). The tree is a very umbrageous one, & the flowers are very fragrant. The genus Villaresia has only one other Australian species, described by me a few years ago,
Presumbly Villaresia moorei Benth. See APNI. & one species in Java, one in the Samoan Group & a few in Chili & Peru.

div.p:
I have sent the diagnosis of your Villaresia to the press for the 5. vol of my fragmenta, which will appear before the end of the year.
MS plant label attached to this letter: 'Villaresia smythii | Ferd. Mueller | Rockingham's Bay.'
